questions.Q: The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the speed of the body at $$t=5\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The speed is given by the slope of the curve at $$t=5\,\text{s}$$, which is zero:

questions.Q: The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the speed of the body at $$t=8\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The speed is given by the slope of the curve at $$t=8\,\text{s}$$, i.e., $$-\frac{\Delta x}{\Delta t}=-\frac{8}{3}\,\text{m/s}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement of the body for the time interval $$t=0$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: $$\text{area of the shaded trapezoid}, i.e., \Delta x=\frac{1}{2}(4\,\text{s}+10\,\text{s})(8\,\text{m/s})=56\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement of the body for the time interval $$t=7$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: $$\text{area of the shaded triangle}, i.e.,\Delta x=\frac{1}{2}(3\,\text{s})(8\,\text{s})=12\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement of the body for the first three seconds is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: $$\text{area of the shaded triangle}=\Delta x =\frac{1}{2}(3\,\text{s})(8\,\text{m/s})=12\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement of the body for the first four seconds is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: $$\text{area of the shaded rectangle}, i.e., \Delta x =(4\,\text{s})(4\,\text{m/s})=16\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement  of the body for the time interval $$t=3\,\text{s}$$ to $$t=7\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: area of rectangle + area of trapezoid, i.e., $$\Delta x = (1.0\,\text{s})(4.0\,\text{m/s}) +\frac{1}{2}(4.0\,\text{m/s}+2.0\,\text{m/s})(3.0\,\text{s})=4.0\,\text{m}+9.0\,\text{m}=13.0\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the acceleration of the body at $$t=7\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The acceleration is given by the slope of the curve at $$t=7\,\text{s}$$, i.e., $$\frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}=\frac{7.5\,\text{m/s}}{3\,\text{s}}=\frac{15}{6}\,\text{m/s}^2$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement of the body for the time interval $$t=0$$ to $$t=3\,\text{m}$$ is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: $$\text{area of the shaded rectangle}, i.e., \Delta x=(4\,\text{s})(5\,\text{m/s})=15\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity and acceleration against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the displacement of the body for the time interval $$t=3$$ to $$t=6\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The displacement is given by the area under the curve: $$\text{area of the shaded ractangle and shades trapezoid}, i.e., \Delta x=(1\,\text{s})(5\,\text{m/s})+\frac{1}{2}(5\,\text{s}+10\,\text{s})(2\,\text{m/s})=5\,\text{m}+\frac{15}{2}\,\text{m}=\frac{25}{2}\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the acceleration of the body for the time interval $$t=4$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: From the graph it is clear that during the first four seconds the body moves with constant velocity and for the time interval $$t=4$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ it moves with constant acceleration. Thus, the velocity and position are given by: $$\\v(t)=\Big\{\begin{smallmatrix}5 & = & 0\leq t \leq 4\,\text{s} \\ 5+a(t-4) & = & 4\leq t \leq 10\,\text{s}\end{smallmatrix}\\$$ $$\\x(t)=\Big\{\begin{smallmatrix}5t & = & 0\leq t \leq 4\,\text{s} \\20+5(t-4)+\frac{1}{2}a(t-4)^2 & = & 4\leq t \leq 10\,\text{s}\end{smallmatrix}\\$$ Now, from the graph $$x=60\,\text{m}$$ for $$t=8\,\text{s}$$. Plugging these values for $$x$$ and $$t$$ in the second expression for the position we obtain: $$60=20+5(8-4)+\frac{1}{2}a(8-4)^2\therefore a=\frac{5}{2}\,\text{m/s}^2$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the acceleration of the body for the time interval $$t=4$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: From the graph it is clear that during the first four seconds the body moves with constant velocity and for the time interval $$t=4$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ it moves with constant negative acceleration. Thus, the velocity and position are given by: $$\\v(t)=\Big\{\begin{smallmatrix}4 & = & 0\leq t \leq 4\,\text{s} \\ 4+a(t-4) & = & 4\leq t \leq 10\,\text{s}\end{smallmatrix}\\$$ $$\\x(t)=\Big\{\begin{smallmatrix}4t & = & 0\leq t \leq 4\,\text{s} \\16+4(t-4)+\frac{1}{2}a(t-4)^2 & = & 4\leq t \leq 10\,\text{s}\end{smallmatrix}\\$$ Now, from the graph $$x=28\,\text{m}$$ for $$t=10\,\text{s}$$. Plugging these values for $$x$$ and $$t$$ in the second expression for the position we obtain: $$28=16+4(10-4)+\frac{1}{2}a(10-4)^2\therefore a=-\frac{2}{3}\,\text{m/s}^2$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the average velocity of the body for the time interval $$t=2$$ to $$t=5\,\text{s}$$ is:
The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along the x-axis, the average velocity of the body for the time interval $$t=2$$ to $$t=8\,\text{s}$$ is:
The graph shows the position against time for a vehicle moving along the x-axis. From the graph, it can be inferred that the vehicle:

A.opt: It moves with constant velocity for the time interval $$t=3$$ to $$t=7\,\text{s}$$
It moves with constant acceleration for the time interval $$t=3$$ to $$t=7\,\text{s}$$
It moves with constant positive acceleration for the time interval $$t=7$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$
It moves with constant negative acceleration for the time interval $$t=0$$ to $$t=3\,\text{s}$$

questions.E: For the time intervals $$t=0$$ to $$t=3\,\text{s}$$  and $$t=7$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ the vehicle moves with constant acceleration and deceleration respectively as the $$x-t$$ dependence is quadratic (concave upward for the first case and concave downward for the second one), and it moves with constant velocity for the time interval $$t=3$$ to $$t=7\,\text{s}$$ as the relationship between $$x$$ and $$t$$ is linear.
